TEXT.TITLE: TREASURY'S BAKER SEES SMALLER TRADE DEFICIT
TEXT.BODY: Treasury secretary James Baker predicted the U.S. trade deficit would decline 15-20 billion dlrs this year. However, he acknowledged signs were still lacking on such a decline. "We think we are beginning to see changes," he told the House Appropriations Committee. "It has begun to level off (but) we don't see it beginning to go down yet," he told the panel. Reuter
